result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel Leroy Barrett

defendant.name: Barrett, Daniel Leroy
defendant.address: 4593 County Road HH, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 20, 2023 at 08:45 am.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.

2:00 PM Defendant Daniel Leroy Barrett in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Daniel Leroy Barrett.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Status conference scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 08:45 am.
Cash Bond Posted by Sue Barrett.
Court amends bond from $1500 to $500.  All other conditions remain as previously set.

2:13 PM Defendant Daniel Leroy Barrett appeared by video from the Door County Jail. Attorney Brett E Reetz appeared by video for Daniel Leroy Barrett.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses bond modification request. Defense requests cash bond be reduced. State makes statement. Court makes statement, grants request, reduces cash bond.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond
Bail/bond hearing on September 22, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:24 AM Defendant Daniel L Barrett in court, in custody.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Daniel L Barrett.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Based on unavailability of Atty Reetz, Atty Viel requests a bond hearing be scheduled.  Bond remains in effect.

10:25 AM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel Leroy Barrett appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Daniel Leroy Barrett.    Court reviews events in file.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limits for prelim.   Atty Reetz requests this matter track Br. 2 case 20CF2.  State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 11:20 am.
Order Appointing Counsel
Victim Impact Statement of S.F.
Victim Impact Statement of JAH
Court appoints Atty Brett Reetz to represent defendant.  Defendant to reimburse the county at the rate of $100 per month with first payment due by 7/15/22.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 5/31/22.
Restitution Request of Sheryl Furness

10:01 AM    Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel Leroy Barrett appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on where he's at in filling out petition for court appointed counsel form.  Defendant indicates he signed form this morning, should be coming up today. Court reschedules matter. Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
for DC Jail
Adjourned initial appearance on June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Subpoena Witness Data Sheet

10:15 AM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel Leroy Barrett appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Defendant requests court appointed counsel.  Court will send petition for appointment of counsel form to the jail for defendant to fill out.  Court reschedules matter to next week.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release. Alcohol Monitoring - High Level.

1:00 PM   Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel Leroy Barrett appeared by video from the Door County Jail. Defendant indicates he does not qualify for SPD representation. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 6/06/22 at 10:00 am.
